title: More people would play support...
body:
...if Riot stopped making our role intentionally as 'supporty' and helpless as possible. Seriously, stop taking supports who have some offensive capabilities and making them utterly pure utility. And make supports more interesting. And release a female support(barring Leona and 'mage supports') who isn't a healer. With cool utilities like Tahm, Blitz, Thresh, Bard, Alistar. But most of all, stop trying to make them so pure support that people feel helpless to escape, chase, kill or survive alone. Supports are becoming so pigeonholed the small playerbase who uses them are starting to move to fun roles that can do shit.

Psst: This has nothing to do with being over/underpowered. Since that is most of the comments. It's about it being the least played, least liked role because Riot controls it more than any other role. "y built damage one game? Nerf ratios! x got a kill without the ADC present? Destroy their tankiness!" And sticking them so they can only support period and are boring to play.

I main Soraka, Leona and Sona for support... again, it's the absolute least played, least liked role in LoL. Always has been, but recently they have been taking every chance to give support 'support' mechanics that make it so their power is directly tied to their laner. And nerfing any off build supports figure out. The shove them further in a corner of unfun, helplessness that makes it so most the community cringes at the thought of getting stuck with support.

> give support 'support' mechanics

Giving supports support mechanics! _Oh my that shouldn't be!_

Seriously, if something is made to support(aka, buff allies/debuff enemies) not having "support mechanics" on them would be stupid. Do you know why? Because without those mechanics they would be mid/top/jungle. Not support. And we already have people to fill those positions, so why do all supports need to be able to flex into those roles? If you play support you should be able to have fun getting assists, not kills, warding, not cs'ing, and being a pain in the enemies behind rather than being a real threat. People like getting cs, kills, and being a threat in some way, so the support role, in which you should be doing none of those things(threat is possible, but not likely), **will not** appeal to them.

*Sigh* again, I've always played support. "Stereotyping" it as boring doesn't create instant queues for supports, and massive queues for everyone else. Feeling helpless because your ADC gave a kill away and your team is behind does. Being unable to buy items until you complete several necessary support items that have no variety choices on most supports does. I played Healer in WoW, support or specialist in HotS, support in League and healer in Perfect world. I have no problem with supporting being 'boring'. I have problems with how Riot pigeonholes supports and shuts down every off meta support item or gameplay facet they see.

As a Platinum support main I can help explain this to you some.  Support does not get farm and therefore gets less gold than other players.  Therefore support champions have abilities that tend to work well with less farm.  Usually this is in the form of heals, shields, crowd control, other utility effects (ex. bard tunnel). Generally if a support was made to have high scaling then they would not be played as a support but as a mid laner or top laner. 

In simple terms if a champion that is used as a support is strong without items then they would be even more strong with items and therefore be broken as a laner thus requiring a nerf making them weaker at the support role. This forces Riot to make supports have a kit independent of their item build.
